content: Hello! Thank you for contacting XYZ. May I have your name to get started with scheduling your electrical service?
Thanks, Mary! Could you please provide the address where you need the electrical service?
Thank you for that, Mary. Let me confirm you are in our service area.
Great news! 123 Maple Street is within our service area. When would be an ideal time for our electrician to visit you?
I want someone tomorrow morning, first thing.
Let me check our availability for tomorrow morning.
We have an opening at 9 AM tomorrow. Should I book this slot for you, Mary?
Wait, how much is this going to cost? I don’t want any surprise fees. I’m on a fixed budget and don’t like wasting money.
I understand your concern, Mary. The base service call fee is $75 and then the electrician charges $100 per hour. I can provide a more detailed estimate if you describe the work needed.
That sounds very expensive for just checking a few outlets. Are you trying to rip me off? I’m 85, I don’t want to be taken advantage of!

I’m sorry if it feels that way, Mary. Our pricing reflects certified professional work and quality parts. I want to help you get the best service within your budget. Could you tell me what problem you are having with your outlets?
Some of them don’t work when I plug in my lamp. It’s probably a simple thing, I just don’t want to be charged a ton for no reason.
That helps a lot, Mary. Most outlet checks and minor fixes take about an hour, so around $175 total including the service call. We’ll be upfront if we find anything extra needed.
Hmm. Still feels steep for what it is. Can you do any discount? I’m on a tight budget. You should understand that.
I appreciate your situation, Mary, but our prices are set to ensure quality and safety. Unfortunately, I cannot offer discounts. Would you like me to book the 9 AM appointment for you?
I think I'll pass then. If you can’t help me with the price, no thanks. I’ll find someone else.
reason: Customer declined due to pricing concerns
